content: The Altar of Burnt Offering(A)
“You shall make an altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide—the altar shall be square—and its height  three cubits.
You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it. And you shall overlay it with bronze.
Also you shall make its pans to receive its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
You shall make a grate for it, a network of bronze; and on the network you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
You shall put it under the rim of the altar beneath, that the network may be midway up the altar.
And you shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
The poles shall be put in the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar to bear it.
You shall make it hollow with boards; as it was shown you on the mountain, so shall they make
The Court of the Tabernacle(D)
“You shall also make the court of the tabernacle. For the south side  hangings for the court  fine woven linen, one hundred cubits long for one side.
And its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets  bronze. The hooks of the pillars and their bands  silver.
Likewise along the length of the north side  hangings one hundred  long, with its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of bronze, and the hooks of the pillars and their bands of silver.
“And along the width of the court on the west side  hangings of fifty cubits, with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
The width of the court on the east side  fifty cubits.
The hangings on  side  fifteen cubits,  their three pillars and their three sockets.
And on the other side  hangings of fifteen  their three pillars and their three sockets.
“For the gate of the court  a screen twenty cubits long,  blue, purple, and scarlet  and fine woven linen, made by a weaver. It  four pillars and four sockets.
All the pillars around the court shall have bands of silver; their hooks  of silver and their sockets of bronze.
The length of the court  one hundred cubits, the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits,  fine woven linen, and its sockets of bronze.
All the utensils of the tabernacle for all its service, all its pegs, and all the pegs of the court,  of bronze.
The Care of the Lampstand(G)
“And you shall command the children of Israel that they bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to cause the lamp to burn continually.
